latex-text: (1) For code, you can use a \index{code element}\textit{code element} . Thus \lstinline|a^2 + b^ = c^2| is produced by writing \lstinline|[code a^2 + b^ = c^2]| . You can also enclose code in backticks, e.g., \texttt{\char96{}} a^2 + b^2 = c^2 \texttt{\char96{}} .; (2)

(1) \item \textbf{Navigation} . To navigate back and forth between documents in Scripta, use the keyboard shortcuts \errorHighlight{[code]?} ctrl-\errorHighlight{[ - can't have space after the bracket}\errorHighlight{extra ]?} and \lstinline|ctrl-| \errorHighlight{extra ]?} or the buttons \textbf{B} and \textbf{F} .; (2) \item \textbf{Navigation} . To navigate back and forth between documents in Scripta, use the keyboard shortcuts \errorHighlight{[code]?} ctrl-\errorHighlight{[ - can't have space after the bracket}\errorHighlight{extra ]?} and \lstinline|ctrl-| \errorHighlight{extra ]?} or the buttons \textbf{B} and \textbf{F} .; (3) \item \textbf{Navigation} . To navigate back and forth between documents in Scripta, use the keyboard shortcuts \errorHighlight{[code]?} ctrl-\errorHighlight{[ - can't have space after the bracket}\errorHighlight{extra ]?} and \lstinline|ctrl-| \errorHighlight{extra ]?} or the buttons \textbf{B} and \textbf{F} .; (4) \item \textbf{Navigation} .
